net.hudup.core.logistic

Class xURI

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.hudup.core.logistic.xURI
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable

    public class xURI
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable, Cloneable
    This class is a wrapper of URI. Note that URI, abbreviation of Uniform Resource Identifier, is the string of characters used to identify a resource on Internet. Please refer to https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Uniform_Resource_Identifier in order to comprehend URI. The class xURI provides many utility methods which process URI. All URI (s) used in the framework are represented by xURI and so we can identify URI with this xURI.
    A hierarchical URI follows the syntax below:
    [scheme:][//authority][path][?query][#fragment]
    The authority component follows the syntax below:
    [user-info@]host[:port]
    Note, square brackets [...] delineate optional components.
    For example, given the URI “http://jack:secret@localhost:8080/hudup/recommend?itemid=1#filter=0“
    Scheme is “http”. Host is “localhost”. Port is “8080”. User-info is “jack:secret” in which user name is “jack” and password is “secret”. So the authority is “jack:secret@localhost:8080”. Path is “/hudup/recommend”. Query is “itemid=1”. Fragment is “filter=0”.
    Version:
    10.0
    Author:
    Loc Nguyen
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • getLastName

        public java.lang.String getLastName()

        Returns:

      • parseParameterText

        public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> parseParameterText(java.lang.String paramList)
        Parsing the specified parameter string into a map of key-value pairs. For example, the string “itemid=1&userid=2” is parsed into a Map having two entries in which the first entry has key “itemid” and value “1” and the second entry has key “userid” and value “2”.
        Parameters:
        paramList - Specified parameter string
        Returns:
        Map of parameters

      • toParameterText

        public static java.lang.String toParameterText(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> map,
                                               boolean encode)
        Converting a map of key-value pairs into a string. This method is opposite to the method parseParameterText(String). Given a Map having two entries in which the first entry has key “itemid” and value “1” and the second entry has key “userid” and value “2”, this method converts such map into the string “itemid=1&userid=2”.
        Parameters:
        map - Specified Map
        encode - whether encoding according to URL format
        Returns:
        parameter text form
